comment._content: The building in the background (centre) was built in 1893 and is nowadays called The Hans Christian Andersen Castle.

comment.author: 70889503@N00
comment._content: The sailing ship that is there now does not seem to be the original one, as an aerial photo of 1922 does not show a ship at all. (Thank you for adding this to the Historical Gardens group!)

comment.author: 68232573@N00
comment._content:
This is in fact ship no 3 that has been build for this lake.
This is a copy of  a frigate in a 1:10 scale.
Name: Sct. George III. , 
Build in Hvide Sande 1993
Another one was build for amusemanet park  Kurashiki Tivolipark  in Japan
The lake itself  is a part of the moat that once circled the intire city.

comment.author: 61361160@N00
comment._content: Little Niels & Henk van der Eijk Given that the photo was taken between 1890 and 1900, I rather suspect this *is* the original ship!

comment.author: 68232573@N00
comment._content:
Hi Lú
Of course you are rigth. The ship on the photo is not the 3rd one, wether it is no 1 or 2 i can't say  rigth here right now, but since it was possible to sail right into the gardens until about 1880 this might very well be no 1.

comment._content: niyicharles It was a black and white photo taken in about 1890 and then hand painted. You know, with a paint brush. :/ Doesn't anyone read descriptions or tags any more?

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: niyicharles: A description of how a photochrom was created can be found here on the Library of Congress website. It is a process which combines both photography and lithography. Glad to hear you're enjoying the images!
